meanings.definition: A person who sets or follows strict guidelines or limits.
meanings.sent1: The redliners in the office always make sure to finish their work on time.
meanings.sent2: The team leader was known for being a redliner, never missing a deadline.
meanings.sent3: The redliners at the library made sure all the books were neatly arranged by genre.
meanings.sent4: She was a redliner when it came to her daily schedule, never deviating from her plans.
meanings.sent5: The redliners in the group project ensured that every detail was meticulously checked.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals who advocate for extreme measures or actions.
meanings.sent1: The redliners at the meeting proposed radical changes to the project.
meanings.sent2: The political redliners were vocal about their views on the controversial issue.
meanings.sent3: The redliners in the club suggested skydiving as the next activity.
meanings.sent4: The environmental redliners fought passionately for stricter pollution regulations.
meanings.sent5: The redliners in the debate team always pushed for more challenging topics.

meanings.definition: A type of high-performance engine that operates at maximum capacity.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic specialized in tuning redliners for racing competitions.
meanings.sent2: The redliners in the sports cars produced an exhilarating speed on the track.
meanings.sent3: The redliners in the garage were always revving up their engines loudly.
meanings.sent4: The redliners on the drag strip roared as they accelerated down the track.
meanings.sent5: The redliners in the race cars pushed the limits of speed and power.
